name: Very Versatile Chocolate Cake
description: You can whip up this cake in no time. It freezes well too. To fancy up the cake, frost it cake or dust it with powdered sugar. Add some berries and call it a day.
recipeIngredient: 1  stick (4 oz unsalted butter, or 1/2 cup neutral oil)
1 3/4 cups 8.75 oz all-purpose flour, gluten-free flour blend (such as Bobâ€™s Red Mill 1:1), or 1 3/4 cups (8.25 oz) pastry flour
Optional add-ins: 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, (1/3 cup chopped crystallized ginger, or 1/2 cup chocolate chips)
1 cup plus 1 tablespoon buttermilk, (or scant 13 tablespoons buttermilk plus 1 egg)

recipeInstructions.text: Position a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat it to 350F. Oil an 8 or 9-inch, high-sided round cake pan and line it with parchment paper. Flour the pan, tap out the excess flour.
recipeInstructions.name: Position a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat it to 350F. Oil an 8 or 9-inch, high-sided round cake pan and line it with parchment paper. Flour the pan, tap out the excess flour.

recipeInstructions.text: If using butter, melt it in a small pan and set aside to cool. Meanwhile, in a bowl, sift together the cocoa, flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt. Stir in the add-ins, if any. Make a well in the center.
recipeInstructions.name: If using butter, melt it in a small pan and set aside to cool. Meanwhile, in a bowl, sift together the cocoa, flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt. Stir in the add-ins, if any. Make a well in the center.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the buttermilk (or buttermilk and egg), melted butter, and vanilla. Stir into the dry ingredients to moisten all dry ingredients well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the buttermilk (or buttermilk and egg), melted butter, and vanilla. Stir into the dry ingredients to moisten all dry ingredients well.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour into the prepared cake pan, spreading the thick batter out to the edge. Bang the pan on your counter to even things out.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour into the prepared cake pan, spreading the thick batter out to the edge. Bang the pan on your counter to even things out.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 30 to 40 minutes (the 8-inch pan will take close the maximum time), until the cake has risen, feels dry to the touch, and a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool for 10 to 20 minutes before unmolding onto a plate. Cool completely before cutting and serving.
